data.prayer: Spirit, help the people of the the state of Suchitepéquez to be consumed with longing for your Word at all times, like David.
data.verse: My soul is consumed with longing for your laws at all times.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala
data.section_summary: What people or resources could you pray for in this photo?

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Suchitepéquez, Guatemala. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 4 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Spirit, please defend the 86,991 believers in Suchitepéquez against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Spirit, train the church of Suchitepéquez, Guatemala to trust with all their hearts, and you will make their paths straight.
data.verse: Trust in Yahweh with all your heart, and don’t lean on your own understanding. In all your ways acknowledge him, and he will make your paths straight.

data.prayer: Lord, you sent Jesus as a witness to testify about the light so that all the Jew, Spanish-speaking people might believe through him.
Oh Lord, show the fatherless in the state of Suchitepéquez that you can be their real Father.
data.verse: I will be to you a Father. you will be to me sons and daughters,’ says the Lord Almighty.

data.prayer: Lord, raise up apostolic workers to plant churches in every town in the state of Suchitepéquez.
data.verse: The reason I left you in Crete was that you might put in order what was left unfinished and appoint elders in every town, as I directed you.

data.prayer: Father, help your children in Suchitepéquez, Guatemala find someone like the Samaritan Woman today. Someone who will open an entire town to your message of salvation.
data.verse: So the woman left her water jar and went away into town and said to the people, 29 “Come, see a man who told me all that I ever did. Can this be the Christ?” They went out of the town and were coming to him.
